jtxt.emulator.tui

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • jtxt.emulator.tui.Component
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ASCIImage, Container, Decorator, Slider, Table.Column, TextBox

    public abstract class Component
extends java.lang.Object
    The root of all TUI components. A Component may draw itself within the bounds that it has been allocated by a Layout, and may be added to a special kind of Component, which is called a Container. Components should be lightweight and able to draw themselves fairly quickly, as it may be asked to do so many times per second. A Component does not necessarily belong to a terminal, and may be rendered to any object which implements the GlyphBuffer interface. This could be a document, PDF, the terminal emulator, or any number of extensions.
    See Also:
    Terminal, Container, Document, Layout, GlyphBuffer

      • parameters

        protected java.lang.Object parameters
        The parameters that are passed to the layout that this Component's parent container has been initialized with. Do note that an incorrect parameter type (or a type that isn't a parameter) will cause an exception to be thrown at runtime.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(GlyphBuffer buffer)
        Renders the component within the bounds of that this component has been inflated to. A component which updates Glyphs within the bounds that have been allocated by the Layout can be sure that the characters will be updated appropriately; the behavior for a component which does not is undefined.
        Parameters:
        buffer - An object on which a component can draw itself, and which makes certain guarantees about conforming to the bounds which are allocated by a Container's layout.

      • getBounds

        public Region getBounds()
        Gets the bounds that this component has been allocated within its parent container.
        Returns:
        The bounds that this component occupies within its container.

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(Region bounds)
        Sets the bounds of this component to the given Region.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The new bounds that this component may use to render itself within.

      • getLayoutParameters

        public java.lang.Object getLayoutParameters()
        Gets the parameters that define how this component should be placed within its parent container.
        Returns:
        The parameters which define how this component should be placed within its parent.

      • registerObserver

        public void registerObserver(ComponentObserver observer)

        protected void update()
